questions.answer_description:
For the app developers to decide when the updates are installed, they would have to use Windows Update (stand-alone). With WSUS, WUB or SCCM, the system administrator configures when the updates are installed. Windows Update is the only option that allows the user to decide when the updates are installed.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/update/waas-overview#servicing-tools
questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company plans to migrate from a Microsoft volume licensing model to a subscription-based model.
Updates to devices must meet the following requirements:
//IMG//

You need to recommend the appropriate servicing models to update employee laptop computers and mobile phones.
Which servicing models should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate servicing models to the correct teams. Each servicing model may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer given is correct

Engineering team to work with on-premises server so use Windows Server Update Services
Sales to update without on-premises so use Windows Update for Business ("In addition to being able to use Group Policy to manage Windows Update for Business, either option can be configured without requiring any on-premises infrastructure by using Intune." from the link)
Finance to have monitoring so use Configuration Manager
Developer to choose when to update so use Windows Update (stand-alone) ("with IT pros manually configuring the device to be in the Semi-Annual Channel" from the link)
Surel for Engineering 2 solutions are required,
Answer is correct, the trick here is that Financial area needs to be monitored by a single system.

It's not possible to register or update mobile phones in any of the solution except SCCM. Period

Finance and engineering go to SCCM
Developer can use stand alone 
Sales can use WUB though putting mobile phones there is terrible question

The explanation given...stating that Windows Update allows users to decide when update takes place is not true..It allows to defer for 30 days..thats all. Whereas Windows update for business allows to defer for up to 365 days. WSUS en MECM allow users to approve with the update. So...I dont know the correct answer to be frankly
Engineering specify "computers and mobile phones". --> Windows Server Update Services is not able to manage mobile phones. So I think the correct answer is SCCM.

comments.content: Indeed, good spot, I didn't realize it, but you are right!
